page.title: 03The fauna of Wharton Woods.
page.content: There are various types of{animals}in} the woodland. For example; the fox ,which is the largest animal in the wood, the hare, rabbit, hedgehog, weasel, stoat,water rat, common rat, water vole, an occasional badger and a small deer has been seen in the past. There are also a few pests like the grey squirrel,together with the rat, rabbits and hares these animals cause greatest damage to the trees and some crops. Many types of{bird}inhabit the wood, such as sparrow, starling, chaffinch, blackbird, blue-tit, raven, kestral, red kite and an{osprey}visited the lake in the woods on July 3rd 1985. The gamekeeper Mr Plant, wishes to preserve all animal life except the pests which damage trees and crops.
